Description: Papyrus (two fragments). Demotic narrative, mythological text on the recto. Two separate texts in a different hand on the verso. These are possibly school exercises. The text on fragment A is written upside down to that on fragment B.
Curator's comments: Bibliography Martin, C.J. 2016-2017. The Michaelides Demotic Material, Enchoria 35: 1-8.

The texts on the recto are published by E. Bresciani in 'Testi demotici nella Collezione Michaelidis', Oriens Antiquus 2 (1963), text III, pp. 8-11 and pl. iv. The verso is unpublished. Publication of the recto and the verso is planned by Joachim Friedrich Quack and Holger Kockelmann.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (55948) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/55948)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fractured, fragile, fragmentary, insect attack Black ink (smudged) Tabbed: kraft paper, glassine paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: C Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
